0: The Netherlands is the second biggest coffee drinker behind Finland. That's a lot of coffee grounds / pods!
1: We drink so much coffee on campus that approximately 20,000 KGs of coffee grounds are recycled per year.
2: Our campus has saved almost 20,000 KGs of E-Waste from ending up in a landfill.
3: The most recycled material on campus is paper, accounting for almost 150,000 KGs per year!
4: 100% of construction waste is being recycled on campus after renovations. That's around 280,000 KGs per year!
5: 50,000 KGs of Hazardous Waste derived from experiments we're properly disposed of in 2023.
6:
There's a chance you wiped your butt with that awful exam!
5% of paper on campus is recycled into TP.
7: 75% of expired food products on campus are fermented in a process that also produces energy!
8: Our campus produces approximately 800,000 KGs of waste per year. Do your part in reducing this number!
9: 100% of our Residual Waste is incinerated in a process that also produces energy.
10: 100% of Organic Waste on campus is fermented with energy recovery.
11: 30% of E-Waste (old devices) is sold to UT Students or Employees instead of being thrown out.
12: The Electronics Store in the EduCafe sells 'E-Waste' (old devices) for cheap. Check it out!
13:
The recycling rate of plastic packaging waste has steadily increased over the years,from 25.2% in 2005 to 40.7% in 2022.
- EU Parliament
14: I can identify up to 59 unique categories of waste.
15: Did you know that you can recycle your E-Waste at the LISA (IT) Office in the Citadel?
16:
Did you know that throwing out batteries is a fire risk?
Drop them off at the nearest Service Desk instead!
17: Did you know that the recycling practices on Campus differ from those in Enschede and Hengelo? Check the rules at your local municipality!
18:
Did you know that you can't recycle Pizza Boxes?
They're too contaminated by oil and grease.
19: Did you know that Chips Packets are notoriously difficult to recycle? They're made out of multiple thin materials stamped together.
